abstract: Saying that the United States has the best capital markets in the world, the JPMorgan chief cautioned on regulatory reform: “Let’s make sure we keep that before we do a bunch of stupid stuff that destroys that.”
snippet: Saying that the United States has the best capital markets in the world, the JPMorgan chief cautioned on regulatory reform: “Let’s make sure we keep that before we do a bunch of stupid stuff that destroys that.”
lead_paragraph: Jamie Dimon, the outspoken chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, sat down on Tuesday for what banking analysts called a “fireside chat” during the Barclays 2012 Global Financial Services Conference.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
